threats.description: Learning effects due to repeated exposure to similar Java code patterns and bug types across trials.
threats.mitigation: Counterbalanced presentation order and inclusion of practice trials.

threats.description: Sample limited to developers with Java experience from university and local tech companies.
threats.mitigation: Recruitment from diverse sources and experience levels (2-8 years).

threats.description: Eye tracking measures visual attention but may not fully capture deeper cognitive processes like working memory load.
threats.mitigation: Combination with behavioral measures (accuracy, response time) and post-task interviews.

threats.description: Generalizability limited to Java code and specific bug types tested.
threats.mitigation: Comparison with original Kip et al. study and discussion of boundary conditions.

limitations: Sample size (N=5) limited statistical power for complex interactions.
Limited to Java programming language and specific bug categories.
Laboratory setting may not reflect natural code review environments.
AOI definitions based on syntactic rather than semantic code analysis.
No control for individual differences in code reading strategies.
confounding_factors: Individual differences in Java expertise levels
Familiarity with specific algorithms used in stimuli
Time of day effects on attention and fatigue
Screen resolution and font size preferences
